flip_chart-centered-content.flip_chart-teacher-facing-paragraph: I wonder, will it ever stop? The clouds fill up. Then with a roar, thunder, lightning, here comes more!
One big. One medium. One is small. I roll and roll each snowy ball. I know it’s cold. Why can’t I stay? My friends and I still want to play.
The leaves rustle. The branches sway. I fly my kite on a windy day. It floats around from here to there. Then flies high up into the air.
It’s early morning, before sunrise. I can’t wait to see the bright blue skies. We go to the beach to play in the sun, before our vacation is all done.
